publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-7808 Marlyn Glen: Hiroshima-Nagasaki Exhibition Comes to Dundee—That the Parliament welcomes the photographic exhibition, Hiroshima-Nagasaki atomic bombings: 65 years on, to the Wellgate Library, Dundee from 31 January 2011; congratulates Nuclear Free Local Authorities (NFLA) on its 30th anniversary and urges other local authorities to join the NFLA, which aims to increase local accountability over national nuclear policy, to identify the impact of national nuclear policy on communities and work to minimise nuclear hazards and increase public safety, and further urges them to display this timely reminder of the full horror and destructive power of nuclear weapons. Supported by: Gil Paterson*, Bill Wilson*, Cathy Peattie*, Rob Gibson*, Dr Richard Simpson*, Mary Mulligan*, Sandra White*, Patricia Ferguson*, Bill Butler*, Elaine Smith*, Joe FitzPatrick*

S3M-7808 Marlyn Glen: Hiroshima-Nagasaki Exhibition Comes to Dundee—That the Parliament welcomes the photographic exhibition, Hiroshima-Nagasaki atomic bombings: 65 years on, to the Wellgate Library, Dundee from 31 January 2011; congratulates Nuclear Free Local Authorities (NFLA) on its 30th anniversary and urges other local authorities to join the NFLA, which aims to increase local accountability over national nuclear policy, to identify the impact of national nuclear policy on communities and work to minimise nuclear hazards and increase public safety, and further urges them to display this timely reminder of the full horror and destructive power of nuclear weapons. Supported by: Gil Paterson, Bill Wilson, Cathy Peattie, Rob Gibson, Dr Richard Simpson, Mary Mulligan, Sandra White, Patricia Ferguson, Bill Butler, Elaine Smith, Joe FitzPatrick
S3M-7808 Hiroshima-Nagasaki Exhibition Comes to Dundee (lodged on 27 January 2011) Robin Harper*
